title: An Ontology-Driven Annotation of Data Tables

dataPreparation.description: Uses a domain ontology with stopwords, units, value ranges and a list of 'no-result' indicators to normalise and interpret table content.

supportTasks.columnClassification: Rule-based detection of numeric vs symbolic columns using numbers, units and 'no-result' indicators.
supportTasks.typeAnnotation: Assigns numeric/symbolic ontology types to columns by combining title similarity with units/ranges (numeric) and taxonomy term similarity (symbolic).
supportTasks.predicateAnnotation: Identifies n-ary relations from the ontology by combining table title similarity with recognised column types.

revision.description: Fully automatic scoring with thresholds for column typing and relation selection; no manual post-editing is required.

validation.goldStandard: 60 tables (349 columns) from scientific publications in food microbiology; 16 relations annotated.

kg.tripleStore: Domain ontology for food microbiology (numeric/symbolic types and relations)

applicationPurpose: Ontology-driven annotation of scientific web tables to integrate and query data in an XML warehouse.

uncertainFields.reason: DOI is not stated in the paper text; external lookup would be required.
The publication appears in 'WISE 2007 Workshops (LNCS 4832)'; using 'WISE' may conflate workshop vs conference branding.
XML is inferred from the stated goal of building an XML data warehouse; the annotation export format is not formally specified.
A domain ontology is used but no specific KG/triplestore name is given; represented generically.

title: Data Integration for the Relational Web

revision.description: System executes best-effort operators and lets the user review, correct errors, and adjust tables (e.g., select/union/split/rename) during integration.

validation.goldStandard: 52-query workload gathered via Amazon Mechanical Turk; relevance judged by two independent annotators

applicationPurpose: Interactive creation and integration of structured Web data sources into new datasets.

uncertainFields.reason: A DOI is not visible in the provided PDF; one may exist in digital libraries.
The system does not rely on a knowledge graph; no triple store is mentioned.
The paper does not specify a serialisation format for outputs (e.g., CSV, RDF).
Reported results are percentages of relevant tables in top-k; mapped to Hits@k/Top-k Accuracy.
Screenshots suggest an interactive interface; the exact tool type/name is not formally specified.

title: Fuzzy Annotation of Web Data Tables Driven by a Domain Ontology

dataPreparation.description: Tables are extracted from the Web, stored in a common XML model, and lemmatised/normalised; numeric vs symbolic columns are segregated and units detected before annotation.
dataPreparation.unitsOfMeasurements: Ontology defines allowed units and numeric ranges (e.g., °C/°F for Temperature) used to filter and score numeric columns.

supportTasks.columnClassification: Distinguishes numeric vs symbolic columns using ontology units; classifies symbolic columns to ontology symbolic types via cosine similarity over titles and cell contents.
supportTasks.datatypeAnnotation: Assigns numeric columns to ontology numeric types using units and value-range constraints; builds fuzzy sets (e.g., intervals, mean±SE).
supportTasks.typeAnnotation: Assigns symbolic columns to ontology symbolic types by combining title/content similarity and taxonomy matches.
supportTasks.predicateAnnotation: Recognises relations by comparing the table's typed-column signature to n-ary relation signatures in the ontology and combining with title similarity.

entityLinking.description: Links cells to ontology taxonomy terms using cosine similarity and proportional-advantage thresholds; keeps fuzzy membership over multiple candidates.
entityLinking.candidateGeneration: Lookup against all terms in the relevant type's taxonomy derived from the ontology.
entityLinking.entityDisambiguation: Selects best type per cell if advantage over second-best exceeds a threshold; retains a fuzzy set of candidates with membership scores.

revision.description: Annotation pipeline runs automatically; fuzzy memberships enable optional later human validation without changing the core outputs.

domain.type: food microbiology; chemical risk in food; aeronautics

validation.goldStandard: Manually annotated scientific tables (e.g., 60 tables with 123 relations; additional corpora and column-level evaluations).

applicationPurpose: Data enrichment and integration into the MIEL querying ecosystem.

uncertainFields.reason: The annotation component is implemented within the @Web software, while MIEL is the querying system; the paper does not brand the annotator separately.
Cell-level linking is to ontology taxonomy terms rather than to a public KG; mapping to CEA is inferred from description rather than explicit task naming.
Tables are said to come from publications and the Web; PDFs are likely but not always explicitly stated for every corpus.
An OWL domain ontology is used, but no specific triple store or public KG (e.g., DBpedia) is named.
@Web is a software platform; the existence of a dedicated end-user GUI for annotation is implied but not detailed.
The DOI is not provided in the paper text available; leaving it empty to avoid inventing information.
